loginUrl.label: common,security
loginUrl.description: URL of the Salesforce instance used for authentication by default set to https://login.salesforce.com

clientId.label: common,security
clientId.description: OAuth Consumer Key of the connected app configured in the Salesforce instance setup. Typically a connected app needs to be configured but one can be provided by installing a package.

clientSecret.label: common,security
clientSecret.description: OAuth Consumer Secret of the connected app configured in the Salesforce instance setup.

refreshToken.label: common,security
refreshToken.description: Refresh token already obtained in the refresh token OAuth flow. One needs to setup a web application and configure a callback URL to receive the refresh token or configure using the builtin callback at https://login.salesforce.com/services/oauth2/success or https://test.salesforce.com/services/oauth2/success and then retrive the refresh_token from the URL at the end of the flow. Note that in development organizations Salesforce allows hosting the callback web application at localhost.

userName.label: common,security
userName.description: Username used in OAuth flow to gain access to access token. It's easy to get started with password OAuth flow but in general one should avoid it as it is deemed less secure than other flows.

password.label: common,security
password.description: Password used in OAuth flow to gain access to access token. It's easy to get started with password OAuth flow but in general one should avoid it as it is deemed less secure than other flows. Make sure that you append security token to the end of the password if using one.

actions.name: New record
actions.description: Create a new record like Account, Contact or Order on Salesforce.

propertyDefinitionSteps.name: Name of the object
propertyDefinitionSteps.description: Specify the Salesforce object name of the record to create

propertyDefinitionSteps.name: Name of the object
propertyDefinitionSteps.description: Specify the Salesforce object name of the record to delete

actions.name: Delete record by external identifier
actions.description: Delete a record from Salesforce based on the value of an external identifier.

propertyDefinitionSteps.name: Name of the object
propertyDefinitionSteps.description: Specify the Salesforce object name of the record to delete

propertyDefinitionSteps.name: External identifier field name
propertyDefinitionSteps.description: Specify the field name of the external identifier

sObjectIdName.description: Field name of the external identifier

actions.name: Fetch record
actions.description: Fetches a record from Salesforce by its identifier value.

propertyDefinitionSteps.name: Name of the object
propertyDefinitionSteps.description: Specify the Salesforce object name of the record to fetch

actions.name: Fetch record by external identifier
actions.description: Fetches a record from Salesforce by the value of an external identifier.

propertyDefinitionSteps.name: Name of the object
propertyDefinitionSteps.description: Specify the Salesforce object name of the record to fetch

propertyDefinitionSteps.name: External identifier field name
propertyDefinitionSteps.description: Specify the field name of the external identifier

sObjectIdName.description: Field name of the external identifier

propertyDefinitionSteps.name: Name of the object
propertyDefinitionSteps.description: Specify the Salesforce object name of the record to update

actions.name: Create or update record
actions.description: Create or update a record on Salesforce.

propertyDefinitionSteps.name: Name of the object
propertyDefinitionSteps.description: Specify the Salesforce object name of the record to create or update

propertyDefinitionSteps.name: Identifier field name
propertyDefinitionSteps.description: Specify the field name that holds the identifying value

actions.name: On create
actions.description: Get notified when an Salesforce record is created.

propertyDefinitionSteps.name: Name of the object
propertyDefinitionSteps.description: Specify the Salesforce object name for which to receive notification when records are created

actions.name: On update
actions.description: Get notified when an Salesforce record is updated.

propertyDefinitionSteps.name: Name of the object
propertyDefinitionSteps.description: Specify the Salesforce object name for which to receive notification when records are updated

actions.name: On delete
actions.description: Get notified when an Salesforce record is deleted.

propertyDefinitionSteps.name: Name of the object
propertyDefinitionSteps.description: Specify the Salesforce object name for which to receive notification when records are deleted

brokerUrl.label: common
brokerUrl.description: Location to send data to or obtain data from.

username.label: common,security
username.description: Access the broker with this userâ€™s authorization credentials.

password.label: common,security
password.description: Password for the specified user account.

clientID.label: common,security
clientID.description: Required for connections to close and reopen without missing messages. Connection destination must be a topic.

skipCertificateCheck.label: common,security
skipCertificateCheck.description: For convenience in only development environments. Do not set for secure production environments.

actions.name: Publish messages
actions.description: Send data to the destination you specify.

propertyDefinitionSteps.name: Select the JMS Destination
propertyDefinitionSteps.description: Specify AMQ Connection Factory properties, including Queue or Topic Name

destinationName.description: Name of the queue or topic to send data to.

destinationType.description: By default, the destination is a topic.

persistent.label: producer
persistent.description: Message delivery is guaranteed when Persistent is selected.

actions.name: Subscribe for messages
actions.description: Receive data from the destination you specify.

propertyDefinitionSteps.name: Select the JMS Destination
propertyDefinitionSteps.description: Specify AMQ Connection Factory properties, including Queue or Topic Name

destinationName.description: Name of the queue or topic to receive data from.

destinationType.description: By default, the destination is a topic.

durableSubscriptionId.label: consumer
durableSubscriptionId.description: Set the ID that lets connections close and reopen with missing messages. Connection type must be a topic.

messageSelector.label: consumer,advanced
messageSelector.description: Specify a filter expression to receive only data that meets certain criteria.

actions.name: Request response using messages
actions.description: Send data to the destination you specify and receive a response.

propertyDefinitionSteps.name: Select the JMS Destination
propertyDefinitionSteps.description: Specify AMQ Connection Factory properties, including Queue or Topic Name

destinationName.displayName: Name of the queue or topic to send data to.
destinationName.description: DestinationName is a JMS queue or topic name. By default the destinationName is interpreted as a queue name.

destinationType.description: By default, the destination is a topic.

messageSelector.label: consumer,advanced
messageSelector.description: Specify a filter expression to receive only responses that meet certain criteria.

namedReplyTo.label: producer
namedReplyTo.description: The destination sends the response to this queue or topic.

persistent.label: producer
persistent.description: Message delivery is guaranteed when Persistent is selected.

responseTimeOut.label: producer,advanced
responseTimeOut.description: Amount of time a connection waits for a response message before throwing a runtime exception.

actions.name: Invoke SQL
actions.description: Invoke SQL to get data in and/or out

propertyDefinitionSteps.name: SQL Statement
propertyDefinitionSteps.description: Enter a SQL Statement starting with INSERT, SELECT, UPDATE or DELETE

query.description: SQL Statement to be executed. Can contain input parameters prefixed by ':#' i.e. ':#MYPARAMNAME'

actions.name: Periodic SQL Invocation
actions.description: Invoke SQL to periodically get data out

propertyDefinitionSteps.name: SQL Statement
propertyDefinitionSteps.description: Enter a SQL Statement starting with SELECT

query.description: SQL Select Statement to be executed

schedulerPeriod.description: Delay in milli seconds between scheduling (executing)

actions.name: Invoke Stored Procedure
actions.description: Invoke a Stored Procedure to get Data in and/or out

propertyDefinitionSteps.name: Procedure Name
propertyDefinitionSteps.description: Select the Stored Procedure

actions.name: Periodic Stored Procedure Invocation
actions.description: Periodically Invoke a Stored Procedure to get Data out

propertyDefinitionSteps.name: Procedure Name
propertyDefinitionSteps.description: Select the Stored Procedure

schedulerPeriod.description: Delay in milli seconds between scheduling (executing)

specification.label: producer
specification.description: Upload the Swagger specification for your Custom API Client Connector. Custom API's are RESTful APIs and can be hosted anywhere, as long as a well-documented swagger is available and conforms to OpenAPI standards.

host.label: producer
host.description: Scheme hostname and port to direct the HTTP requests to in the form of https://hostname:port. Can be configured at the endpoint component or in the correspoding REST configuration in the Camel Context. If you give this component a name (e.g. petstore) that REST configuration is consulted first rest-swagger next and global configuration last. If set overrides any value found in the Swagger specification RestConfiguration. Can be overriden in endpoint configuration.

basePath.label: producer
basePath.description: API basePath for example /v2. Default is unset if set overrides the value present in Swagger specification.

authenticationType.label: producer
authenticationType.description: Type of authentication used to connect to the API

authorizationEndpoint.label: producer
authorizationEndpoint.description: URL for the start of the OAuth flow

tokenEndpoint.label: producer
tokenEndpoint.description: URL to fetch the OAuth Access token

oauthScopes.label: producer
oauthScopes.description: URL to fetch the OAuth Access token

host.label: producer
host.description: Scheme hostname and port to direct the HTTP requests to in the form of https://hostname:port. Can be configured at the endpoint component or in the correspoding REST configuration in the Camel Context. If you give this component a name (e.g. petstore) that REST configuration is consulted first rest-swagger next and global configuration last. If set overrides any value found in the Swagger specification RestConfiguration. Can be overriden in endpoint configuration.

basePath.label: producer
basePath.description: API basePath for example /v2. Default is unset if set overrides the value present in Swagger specification.

authenticationType.label: producer
authenticationType.description: Type of authentication used to connect to the API

clientId.label: producer
clientId.description: OAuth Client ID, sometimes called Consumer Key

clientSecret.label: producer
clientSecret.description: OAuth Client Secret, sometimes called Consumer Secret

authorizationEndpoint.label: producer
authorizationEndpoint.description: URL for the start of the OAuth flow

tokenEndpoint.label: producer
tokenEndpoint.description: URL to fetch the OAuth Access token

oauthScopes.label: producer
oauthScopes.description: URL to fetch the OAuth Access token
